en: his is Rich Kleinfeldt.
And this is Sarah Long with THE MAKING OF A NATION,
zh: 这里是莎拉 · 朗为您带来的《建立一个国家》

en: a VOA Special English program
zh: 美国之音慢速英语节目

en: about the history of the United States.
Today, we tell about
the first permanent English settlements
zh: 第一个永久性的英国殖民地

en: in North America.
England was the first country
to compete with Spain
for claims in the New World,
although it was too weak
to do this openly at first.
But Queen Elizabeth of England
zh: 但是皇后伊丽莎白·斯图亚特(查理一世女)

en: supported such explorations
as early as the 1570s.
Sir Humphrey Gilbert
led the first English settlement efforts.
zh: 率领英国人开拓殖民地。

en: He did not establish
any lasting settlement.
He died
as he was returning to England.
zh: 当他回到英格兰的时候。

en: Gilbert's half brother Sir Walter Raleigh
zh: 吉尔伯特同父异母兄弟的沃尔特·雷利

en: continued his work.
Raleigh sent a number of ships
to explore the east coast of North America.
He called the land Virginia
zh: 他称这片土地为弗吉尼亚

en: to honor England's
unmarried Queen Elizabeth.
In 1585, about one-hundred men
settled on Roanoke Island,
off the coast of the present day state
zh: 在现在这个州的海岸外

en: of North Carolina.
These settlers returned to England a year later.
zh: 这些定居者一年后回到英国。

en: Another group went to Roanoke the next year.
zh: 第二年又有一群人去了罗阿诺克。

en: This group included
a number of women and children.
But the supply ships Raleigh sent
zh: 但是罗利派来的补给船

en: to the colony failed to arrive.
When help got there in 1590,
none of the settlers could be found.
zh: 没有一个定居者被找到。

en: History experts still are not sure what happened.
zh: 历史专家仍然不确定发生了什么。

en: Some research suggests that
at least some of the settlers
became part of the Indian tribe
zh: 成为印第安部落的一部分

en: that lived in the area.
One reason for the delay
in getting supplies to Roanoke
was the attack of the Spanish Navy
against England in 1588.
King Phillip of Spain had decided
zh: 西班牙国王菲利普决定

en: to invade England.
But the small English ships
combined with a fierce storm
defeated the huge Spanish fleet.
zh: 击败了庞大的西班牙舰队。

en: As a result,
Spain was no longer able to
block English exploration.
England discovered that
supporting colonies so far away
was extremely costly.
So Queen Elizabeth took no more action to do this.
zh: 所以伊丽莎白女王不再采取任何行动。

en: It was not until after her death in 1603
that England began serious efforts
to start colonies in America.
In 1606, the new English King,
James the First,
gave two business groups permission
zh: 给了两个商业集团许可

en: to establish colonies in Virginia,
zh: 在弗吉尼亚建立殖民地,

en: the area claimed by England.
zh: 英国声称拥有主权的地区。

en: Companies were organized
to carry out the move.
The London Company sent
one hundred settlers to Virginia in 1606.
The group landed there in May, 1607
zh: 他们于1607年5月在那里登陆

en: and founded Jamestown.
It was the first permanent English colony
zh: 它是第一个永久的英国殖民地

en: in the new world.
The colony seemed about to
fail from the start.
The settlers did not plant their crops in time
zh: 定居者没有及时种庄稼

en: so they soon had no food.
zh: 所以他们很快就没有食物了。

en: Their leaders lacked the farming and building skills
zh: 他们的领导人缺乏耕作和建筑技能

en: needed to survive on the land.
More than half the settlers died
zh: 超过一半的定居者死了

en: during the first winter.
The businessmen controlling the colony from London knew
zh: 从伦敦控制殖民地的商人知道

en: nothing about living in such a wild place.
zh: 没有关于生活在这样一个野生的地方。

en: They wanted the settlers
to search for gold,
and explore local rivers
in hopes of finding a way to the East.
zh: 希望能找到去东方的路。

en: One settler knew this was wrong.
zh: 一位定居者知道这是错误的。

en: His name was Captain John Smith.
zh: 他的名字是约翰·史密斯（探险家）。

en: He helped the colonists
build houses and grow food
by learning from the local Indians.
Still, the Jamestown settlers continued to die each year
zh: 尽管如此，詹姆斯敦定居者每年还是不断死去

en: from disease, lack of food and Indian attacks.
zh: 疾病、食物短缺和印第安人的袭击。

en: The London Company sent six thousand settlers
zh: 伦敦公司派遣了六千名定居者

en: to Virginia between 1606 and 1622.
zh: 在1606年到1622年间到达弗吉尼亚。

en: More than four thousand died during that time.
zh: 在此期间有四千多人死亡。

en: History experts say that
all the settlers surely would have died
zh: 所有的定居者肯定都死了

en: without the help of the local Powhatan Indians.
zh: 没有当地波瓦坦印第安人的帮助。

en: The Indians gave the settlers food.
zh: 印第安人给定居者食物。

en: They taught them how to live in the forest.
zh: 他们教他们如何在森林里生活。

en: And the Powhatan Indians showed the settlers
zh: 波瓦坦印第安人向殖民者展示

en: how to plant new crops
and how to clear the land for building.
zh: 以及如何清理土地用于建设。

en: The settlers accepted the Indians' help.
zh: 定居者接受了印第安人的帮助。

en: Then, however, the settlers took whatever else
zh: 然而，殖民者拿走了其他的东西

en: they wanted by force.
In 1622, the local Indians attacked the settlers
zh: 1622年，当地印第安人袭击了定居者

en: for interfering with Indian land.
Three hundred forty settlers died.
The colonists answered the attack
zh: 殖民者回击了这次进攻

en: by destroying the Indian tribes
living along Virginia's coast.
The settlers recognized that
zh: 殖民者认识到了这一点

en: they would have to grow their own food
zh: 他们必须自己种植食物

en: and survive on their own
without help from England or anyone else.
zh: 没有英格兰或其他任何人的帮助。

en: The Jamestown colony was clearly established by 1624.
zh: 詹姆斯敦殖民地于1624年明确建立。

en: It was even beginning to earn money
by growing and selling a new crop, tobacco.
zh: 通过种植和销售一种新的作物，烟草。

en: The other early English settlements in North America
zh: 其他早期英国人在北美的定居点

en: were much to the north of Virginia,
in the present state of Massachusetts.
The people who settled there
left England for different reasons than those
zh: 因为不同的原因离开了英格兰

en: who settled in Jamestown.
The Virginia settlers were looking for ways
zh: 弗吉尼亚殖民者在寻找方法

en: to earn money for English businesses.
The settlers in Massachusetts were seeking religious freedom.
zh: 马萨诸塞州的定居者寻求宗教自由。

en: King Henry the Eighth of England
had separated from the Roman Catholic Church.
His daughter, Queen Elizabeth,
zh: 他的女儿，伊丽莎白女王,

en: established the Protestant religion in England.
It was called the Church of England,
or the Anglican Church.
The Anglican Church, however,
was similar to that of the Roman Catholic Church.
Not all Protestants liked this.
zh: 不是所有的新教徒都喜欢这样。

en: Some wanted to leave the Anglican Church
zh: 有些人想离开英国国教

en: and form religious groups of their own.
In 1606, members of one such group in the town of Scrooby
zh: 1606年，Scrooby 的一个这样的团体的成员

en: did separate from the Anglican Church.
About one hundred twenty-five people
left England for Holland.
They found problems there too,
so they decided to move again to the New World.
zh: 所以他们决定再次搬到新大陆。

en: These people were called pilgrims,
because that is the name given
to people who travel for religious purposes.
zh: 为了宗教目的而旅行的人。

en: About thirty-five pilgrims were among the passengers
zh: 乘客中大约有三十五名朝圣者

en: on a ship called the Mayflower in 1620.
zh: 在1620年一艘叫做五月花号的船上。

en: It left England to go to Virginia.
zh: 它离开英格兰去了弗吉尼亚。

en: But the Mayflower never reached Virginia.
zh: 但五月花号从未到达弗吉尼亚。

en: Instead, it landed to the north, on Cape Cod Bay.
zh: 相反，它降落在科德角湾北部。

en: The group decided to stay there
instead of trying to find Jamestown.
The pilgrims and the others on the Mayflower
zh: 五月花号上的朝圣者和其他人

en: saw a need for rules
that would help them live together peacefully.
They believed they were not under English control
zh: 他们相信他们不在英国人的控制之下

en: since they did not land in Virginia.
zh: 因为他们没有在弗吉尼亚登陆。

en: So they wrote a plan of government,
zh: 所以他们制定了一个政府计划,

en: called the Mayflower Compact.
zh: 打电话给五月花号公约。

en: It was the first such plan
zh: 这是第一个这样的计划

en: ever developed in the New World.
They elected a man called William Bradford
zh: 他们选了一个叫威廉·布拉德福德的人

en: as the first governor of their Plymouth Colony.
zh: 作为他们普利茅斯殖民地的第一任总督。

en: We know about the first thirty years of the Plymouth Colony
zh: 我们知道普利茅斯殖民地的前三十年

en: because William Bradford described it
zh: 因为威廉·布拉德福德描述过

en: in his book, Of Plymouth Plantation.
zh: 在他的《普利茅斯种植园》一书中。

en: As happened in Jamestown,
zh: 就像在詹姆斯敦发生的那样,

en: about half the settlers in Plymouth
zh: 普利茅斯一半的定居者

en: died the first winter.
The survivors were surprised
to find an Indian who spoke English.
zh: 找到一个会说英语的印度人。

en: His name was Squanto.
He had been kidnapped by an English sea captain
zh: 他被一个英国船长绑架了

en: and had lived in England
before returning to his people.
zh: 然后回到他的族人身边。

en: The Pilgrims believed
Squanto was sent to them from God.
He made it possible for them
to communicate with the native people.
He showed them the best places to fish,
zh: 他向他们展示了钓鱼的最佳地点,

en: what kind of crops to plant and how to grow them.
zh: 种植什么作物以及如何种植。

en: He provided them with all kinds of information
zh: 他向他们提供了各种各样的信息

en: they needed to survive.
The settlers invited the Indians to a feast
zh: 定居者邀请印第安人参加宴会

en: in the month of November to celebrate their successes
zh: 在十一月庆祝他们的成功

en: and to thank Squanto for his help.
Americans remember that celebration every year
zh: 美国人每年都会记得这个庆祝活动

en: when they observe the Thanksgiving holiday.
zh: 当他们庆祝感恩节的时候。

en: Other English settlers began arriving
zh: 其他英国移民开始陆续到来

en: in the area now called New England.
zh: 在现在被称为新英格兰的地区。

en: One large group was called the Puritans.
zh: 其中一大群人被称为清教徒。

en: Like the pilgrims, the Puritans did not agree
zh: 和朝圣者一样，清教徒也不同意

en: with the Anglican Church.
But they did not want to separate from it.
The Puritans wanted to change it
to make it more holy.
Their desire for this change made them unwelcome in England.
zh: 他们对这种变化的渴望使他们在英国不受欢迎。

en: The first ship carrying Puritans
zh: 第一艘运送清教徒的船

en: left England for America in 1630.
By the end of that summer,
one thousand Puritans had landed
in the northeastern part of the new country.
zh: 在这个新国家的东北部。

en: The new English King, Charles,
zh: 新任英格兰国王查尔斯,

en: had given permission for them
to settle the Massachusetts Bay area.
zh: 来解决马萨诸塞湾地区的问题。

en: The Puritans began leaving England in large groups.
zh: 清教徒开始大批离开英格兰。

en: Between 1630 and 1640,
20,000 sailed for New England.
zh: 两万人乘船前往新英格兰。

en: They risked their lives on the dangerous trip.
zh: 他们在这次危险的旅行中冒着生命危险。

en: They wanted to live among people
zh: 他们想和人们生活在一起

en: who believed as they did,
people who honored the rules of the Bible.
Puritans believed that the Bible was the word of God.
zh: 清教徒相信圣经是上帝的话。

en: The Puritans and other Europeans, however,
zh: 然而，清教徒和其他欧洲人,

en: found a very different people in the New World.
zh: 在新大陆发现了一个完全不同的人。

en: They were America's native Indians.
zh: 他们是美洲土著印第安人。

en: That will be our story next week.
zh: 这将是我们下周的故事。

en: This MAKING OF A NATION program was written by Nancy Steinbach.
zh: 这个《建立一个国家》的节目是由 Nancy Steinbach 编写的。

en: This is Rich Kleinfeldt And this is Sarah Long.
zh: 这是 Rich Kleinfeldt 这是 Sarah Long。

en: Join us again next week
for another Voice of America Special English program
zh: 另一个美国之音特别英语节目
